title: [Large-scale] Medical English Paper Writing and Literature Reading Competency Enhancement Course: Supporting Clinical Decision-Making through Patient Diagnosis, Treatment Protocols, and Evidence-Based Medicine (EBM)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology, general English reading comprehension, and foundational understanding of patient symptom assessment (e.g., "pain scale," "vital sign monitoring") or treatment protocols (e.g., "medication administration procedures," "infection control guidelines")
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education for adult learners with medical field experience (doctors, nurses, researchers). Emphasizes research design and protocol development skills through real patient case analyses (e.g., 'personalized treatment plans,' 'interdisciplinary team collaboration scenarios'). Stresses evidence-based practice (EBP) reflecting medical ethics and patient safety principles.

learning_goals: Learners accurately use medical terminology (e.g., "myocardial infarction," "diabetes mellitus," "clinical trial") and diagnostic protocol terms (e.g., "symptom assessment," "treatment plan," "protocol adherence") to write 3 abstracts (~500 words each), earning "excellent" ratings in â‰¥4 of 5 evaluation criteria (clarity, accuracy, structure, professionalism, creativity) through peer review and expert evaluation.

Systematic writing following the IMRaD structure of international academic journals and demonstrating clinical applicability of research outcomes (e.g., improving patient treatment protocols, establishing symptom management strategies).

Cultivating syntactic analysis of complex medical sentences, summarization of core content, and evidence-based conclusion drawing from medical literature (e.g., enhancing patient safety, verifying treatment efficacy).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
